name: Aleks
text: Refactoring is an investment. You should be able to justify the effort to refactor the code on its long-term benefits. As for code reviews, I now think that its effectivity is largely dependent on when it's conducted. It's less effective when the developer is already done with the whole module/functionality and the QA team is about to do their thing. I think it's better to conduct the reviews when the developer has done a little coding and his design has been laid out.
